result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald R Michael was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7-3-17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.

Restitution set at zero.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
Mental Health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
May not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald R Michael

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, calendar successor, for review. mag
Original Transcript (65 pages) commencing on 07-03-2014 SENTENCINGreceived and filed.

Defendant Donald R Michael in court with attorney Craig S Powell. Denis Stingl for Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
On motion of the State, Court ordered the "Repeater" enhancer dismissed.
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charge. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 2 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/3/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/30/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Complete 20 hours of community service
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Donald R Michael in court with attorney Craig S Powell.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case was calendared for final pretrial this date.  Defense counsels request to vacate the trial and calendar this case for plea and sentencing is granted by the court..    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-03-2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report dated 06-09-14 received and filed

Defendant Donald R Michael in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 6/10/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 6/23/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Donald R Michael in court with attorney Michael T. Hart.  Defendant Donald R Michael in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case was reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44 due to the assignment of the Assistant District Attorney.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/14/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Donald R Michael in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Donald R Michael in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
